page.title: 09FOX AND GOOSE COOKSMILL GRN
page.content: This is one of the oldest pubs in Essex.It is at least 300 years old. When the A414 was improved it was di- verted north of the pub so the Fox and Goose "crossed over" the road.It used to be a travellers' inn and a "local" pub but now it's more like a restau- rant.Most customers go there for a meal,although the pub has kept its licence for drinks only.The landlady says that most customers are not local people but "passing trade" or busi- nessmen.It is also a popular place for people from nearby towns. Bad weather usually means a quiet day, but a sunny Sunday or Bank Holiday is very busy.They work from 8.00 to Mid- night with a break in the afternoon, but if lunchtime has been busy,then everyone has to help cook more food.At least 10 people are employed here with more casual work in Summer.
